She was jailed for 15 months after she faked documents indicating the centre had won grants of up to £800,000 and was no longer supported by charitable company Creative Support. The centre said the ruling was "outrageous" and a "complete insult".

The experienced 31-year-old, Adam El-Abd, was released by Bristol City in January 2014. He was joined by Gary Deegan, Jim O'Brien and Gary O'Connor at Ashton Gate. Defenders AJ Leitch-Smith, Joseph Riley and AJ Swindon were also released. Former Bury full-back Joe Riley joined Bristol City on a one-year deal, while Micky Mellon continued his squad rebuild with defensive midfielder Joe Riley and striker Gary Dodds. The Seagulls will start the new League One campaign with over 300 appearances between them.

The England rugby coach, Eddie Jones, has revealed that his squad does not have the same level of leadership as the side that won the 2015 World Cup. The British coach has called on England to invest in the "potential of individual leaders" if they want to be a "World Cup-winning side". Jones has also revealed that he is planning to name a small and good group for the 2019 tournament, which will be held in Japan.

Australian batsman Ed Rogers has been announced as the new addition to the Somerset squad for the upcoming county cricket season. Rogers, 38, has agreed to play in next season's County Championship and Maynard thinks it will be a real top signing for the club. The left-hander is still at three for the high-class game but is keen to work with young players, including Australian opener Marcus Trescothick and opener Tom Abell. The signing has delighted Maynard, who is looking forward to working with Rogers. The former West Indies captain also sees Rogers as an important part of the club's development plan.

Police have urged drivers to take care after a Range Rover crashed into a property in Swadlincote, Derbyshire, at about 02:00 BST. The Range Rover ended up embedded in the property, which suffered structural damage but no injuries were reported. Police have launched an investigation and said they were confident that no one was hurt but two people had to leave their home and have not been able to return due to fears over structural damage. The road was closed for about an hour and no drivers suffered minor injuries.

Alice is a person who bought a building on Kingsway to bring it down. It was not known whether asbestos was inside the building, but all the scaffolding outside the building was completed and the outer structure was now ready to be demolished. It is not known whether the scaffolding will still be there in six months.

In the Premier League, football is not getting any fairer, as one of the goals was not allowed to stand in a match between West Bromwich Albion and Leicester City. West Brom manager Tony Pulis was left frustrated after the referee failed to spot an apparent infringement. Despite the defeat, West Brom boss Tony Pulis insists he will continue to push for technology to be used in the top flight.

After capturing the interest of European giants Barcelona, 19-year-old forward Dujon 'Duke' Kapustka has signed a five-year contract with English Premier League side Leicester City. The forward, who cost the English club £7.5m, has impressed in his country's Euro 2016 qualifiers and will join up with the Foxes on Wednesday.

The new collection will be free to view until the building is refurbished. The new roof is due to be completed in 2020.
